# SKPhysicsContact

**Class**

A description of the contact between two physics bodies.

## Declaration

```swift
class SKPhysicsContact
```

## Overview

An [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKPhysicsContact] object is created automatically by SpriteKit to describe a contact between two physical bodies in a physics world.To receive contact messages, read the [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKScene/physicsWorld] property of an [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKScene] object you are interested in, and assign its [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKPhysicsWorld/contactDelegate] property to point to an object that implements the [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKPhysicsContactDelegate] protocol. Then, for each physics body in your scene, set the [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKPhysicsBody/categoryBitMask] and [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKPhysicsBody/contactTestBitMask] properties to define which interactions should generate contact messages.

## Inspecting the Contact Properties

- **bodyA**: The first body in the contact.
- **bodyB**: The second body in the contact.
- **contactPoint**: The contact point between the two physics bodies, in scene coordinates.
- **collisionImpulse**: The impulse that specifies how hard these two bodies struck each other in Newton-seconds.
- **contactNormal**: The normal vector specifying the direction of the collision.

## Physics Simulation

- **Getting Started with Physics**: Simulate gravity, acceleration, collision detection, or joints.
- **SKPhysicsWorld**: The driver of the physics engine in a scene; it exposes the ability for you to configure and query the physics system.
- **SKPhysicsBody**: An object that adds physics simulation to a node.
- **SKPhysicsContactDelegate**: Methods your app can implement to respond when physics bodies come into contact.
- **SKFieldNode**: A node that applies physics effects to nearby nodes.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSObjectProtocol
